intro: Phyllanthus tukuyuanus, commonly known as the Tukuyuan spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and smooth, succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
